text: One of my boyfriends favorite places come eat it had one of the best salads I have had in a long time chicken almonds on a bed of greens with balsamic dressing. My boyfriend loves the streak with the mushroom sauce he's in food a coma. Make sure to get Lauren she is wonderful so attentive, sweet, and friendly. They are lucky to have her working for them .

Went in for Father's Day breakfast this morning. The restaurant side was not busy whatsoever. I would say there was maybe a total of 4 tables being served. They only had one waitress and the service was absolutely terrible. I've never been a server, but I could have worked laps around this waitress. She was extremely unorganized, lost and should not have been serving. When she brought out our food she literally brought out one plate at a time. I ordered French toast and when she was down bringing all the food, which took about 10 mins, I asked for syrup. Before brining my syrup she went and took another tables order. By the time I received my syrup the French toast was freezing cold. In addition to the syrup, she never brought our bread that went along with the breakfast. After asking for our bread, she finally brought 3 orders of wheat bread. I guess she assumed everyone at the table ate wheat bread over white bread. The bread was hard as a rock and stale. Then we needed drink refills and that took another 10 mins because our waitress was busy hearing other people complain to her how bad her service was. I overheard two there tables complain that they needed silverware and drinks after they've been sitting for over 20 mins. I even noticed her bring out food to a table, then bring them their silverware and drinks. It was ridiculous. After hearing our waitress tell us how busy she was and stressed, she finally went and asked the bartender to help her serve the four other tables. I couldn't imagine what would have happen if they were actually busy. Long story short, the food sucked balls and the service was the worst. Thankfully it was very entertaining to watch everyone else complain and walk out. I'm thinking the owners need to either hire some experienced waitress or train them. In addition make sure you are or staffed accordingly ( even though it was not busy) but it was Fathers Day so be prepared. We will never be going back to the Lodge at Cactus for food and I suggest everyone else to avoid as well. I've never seen such terrible service.

We only came here because we had an entertainment coupon.  We set it on the table in full site. We ordered and then she tells us they don't c take those anymore and haven't for 6 months. That means they only took them for 1 month? ?? Are eating or salad,  we notice there's a series piece of foods on the back side.  GROSS. All she could say was sorry. The  ice tea is awful. ... very weak. The ribeye was $19 and lots of grissl. Very disappointed.  And she was not very friendly.  We definitely won't come back.

Really love their two for one dinners on Wednesday nights!! Makes eating out nice and affordable! And their grilled cheese and tomato soup, to die for!! I crave it. Plus awesome place for Sunday football games.
I waited in the dining room for food for over 20 minutes, and no one came out to take our order. My first time here as well and will probably never come back. Thanks a lot.

We go 3-4 times a month if not more.  GREAT food, GREAT bar staff.  Often they have great dining specials  We were referred to the Shelbourne location for crab legs....AHHHH MAZING! so we decided to see the cactus location for their rib eye.. DELICIOUS.  We'll be back  as usual.  Wish they would coming food and bar on the same  tab

The BEST pub in Southwest !!! the bartendress/bartenders/waitress's and the chef is VERY friendly ... they let me create the very 1st LOCO MOCO SOUTHERN STYLE ! 
( breakfast potatoes hambuger patty 3 eggs and gravy )
BORN DATE 02-23-2015 7:20AM Christine the bartendress took the order and got the chefs approval 
Not only it looks GOOD !!! ITS AWESOME !!! and ITS MASSIVE !!!!!

This is one of those restaurants-attached-to-local-video-poker-bars here in Las Vegas. The nonsmoking restaurant is hermetically sealed off from the (smoking) bar area, but sometimes the door is left open. The food is pretty good if you can get served, which is hit or miss, mostly miss. About 50% of the time nobody notices us and we leave. Or if you do get ser ved you'll wait forever for thngs like drink refills or taking your credit card to pay the bill.

For some reason the cops eat here, probably because there are so few restaurants in this part of town.
Great atmosphere! Food was good and very reasonably priced. Service was mediocre but the server was at least nice.

Excellent Staff & GREAT Food!!!

I just recently moved to a new house in the area and I love coming here after work beautiful nice bartenders great food and fun people to mingle with!! Not a better place you can ask for and I truly love it here! Ask for jennifer shes a awesome bartender always on point and great to socialize with!!!!

Love my new local bar !!!!

The lodge is a pretty good "neighborhood" bar.  It's never that crowded, the drinks are reasonably priced, and the food is typical bar food, but usually that means fried, or served with fried stuff, so its always tasty.  The Lodge has some of the comfiest seating ever though... some of its couch and chair seating arrangements are perfect for having a few beers with friends while you wind down the evening.  This place serves its purpose well... its comfy and sometimes that's what you need.

Menu doesn't have the largest selection but the food is excellent. Service is always good too. Separate dining area from the bar and lots of nice TV's for the sports. Try the Tri-Tip Dip Philly Style and add some jalapeños to it!

I have lived in southern highlands for 14 years and have visited the lodge several times.  I noticed customer service getting worse a few years ago and stopped going as much. Every once in a while I will stop in to see if it's better and it does not seem to improve. 
I go in on a Saturday around 1pm there are 6 people in there 7 including the bartender. Needless to say it is pretty easy to notice a new patron. After getting money to gamble I sit down and watch the bartender serve a customer and go to the well to finish talking to her friends. Giving her the benefit of the doubt I move to an area I am more visible about 5 seats away from her. She is cleaning bottles wiping the well and talking to her friends still. she then asks the guy 2 seats away from me if he wants another beer. she pours it, serves him and goes back to wiping the refers. about a minute later she walks right in front of me grabs something and goes back to her well to to talk more to her friends. This will be the last time I visit this place until PT'S or remedys buy this place. With consistent bad service that I have received I know I can not be alone. it's a shame this place is so poorly run and the employees are not trained at how to work in a customer based industry, it could do much better. But I guess 6 people on a Saturday during college football is enough for them. I wish there was a 0 stars.

This place is great. EXCEPT... dont expect to get ANY service if you like to play pool, Golden Tee, or Buck Hunter. Unless your dating someone there or are foolish enough to gamble ungodly amounts of money. You could probably pack your own drinks in and nobody would notice. My friends call it the area of invisibilty. We are currently looking fo another place to regular at.
Great place.....very clean establishment......amazing service and food.......AWESOME BARTENDERS!!

The atmosphere is fantastic. A lot of room at the bar to sit, plenty of video poker machines to play, jukebox and two pool tables. If that's not enough, a fireplace with large overstuffed chairs and sofa, help make for one very cozy setting. They also have a dining area that is completely separate from the bar which serves up really nice food. My only gripe is the beer selection. Not what I would usually go for.

Service was friendly but REALLY slow, as always.  We came 4 their Valentine's special but they ran out of bottles of Chardonnay.  Wat kind of bar manager lets his bar run out of Chardonnay on Valentines Day?

I guess it all depends on the day you go in how the food and service is.  Ordered something Monday,  back today and was COMPLETELY different. 
I've never had to pay for a drink(s) when I gamble in there yet today I got charged for a beer after spending MORE than I've ever spent in here.... and I drank way less than I ever have in here. 
I won't EVER be back due to the bartender today, which is a shame bc I was here at least once a week before. Smh.
Not a bad local spot to chill at. The bartenders has always been helpful and on point, I can't complain ,also the burgers are pretty darn good. I like it because it's pretty low key and friendly.

The Lodge at Cactus is my second home:) It's a neighborhood bar... Like Cheers, I go here because everyone knows my name. Fun, friendly staff, good food, great drinks, and sports on the TVs. What more could you want in a bar?

We sit at the bar and enjoy the music and sports on the HD TV's.  They have a separate dinning area.  Great food and service.  We recently moved into the neighborhood and have frequented The Lodge several times.  The bartenders are friendly and courteous.  They have a couple of pool tables and a Golden Tee golf game.  Nice place to kick back and enjoy your favorite game while enjoying a meal or cocktail.
Until I get an APOLOGY from the Cactus Lodge for the staff behavior on April 5th at approx. 11pm, I will NOT be giving the Cactus Lodge a 5 star rating.  BOOOOO to the CACTUS LODGE!!!!!!!!!

Terrible experience, ordered to go from the bar and the order was incorrect.  Very simple order, only 2 items from the menu and they did not get it correct.  The worst part of the experience was chasing down a bartender/waitress when I showed up just to get my order in.  Service to the customers was clearly the last thing on all of their minds as I stand there waiting just to place my order.  I am a very understanding person when it comes to being busy but the place was fairly quiet.

The food was excellent. We ordered chicken parmesan & cheese burger. They were both well seasoned and delicious. I couldn't finish the chicken & pasta...it was such a large portion, I took it to go instead. Although I had no luck at the video poker machine (4 stars LOL!), the guys had a good time at the pool table. The graveyard bartender was very attentive and fast!!! I forgot his name...good guy though. We came by to visit Pat another bartender that works there. Such a cool dude!!! Yeah we'll be back again to visit Pat & eat more food. :)

So I've been here two total times. The first time, I met a great girl at the bar. Unfortunately, she was 19. She met the bartender (roids/chin strap bartender who was there both times I came in, around 6pm) on Tinder and he invited her in. Knowing she was 19. He's.. 37 I think she said, definitely late 30s. Classy. I have her phone number if the owners/alcohol board is curious.

Today, I came in and played about 250 hands of Blackjack. After getting comped one drink, I asked for another. Ended up losing the $20 I entered, but played no less than 75 hands after the last beer was issued (two total). $1 or more per hand (with multiple $10 bets in a single hand), minimum 10 hands per minute (seriously). He then charged me for the second drink, and said "trust me bro, it's the same everywhere bro. Been in this business a long time. All the bars are like this."

Interesting news! None of the bars are like that. You don't only comp drinks for losing players. That defeats the purpose. I've been to probably 100+ bars with blackjack machines in Vegas, this is quite literally the only one that has that absurd policy. If someone were to be playing poker and hit $2,000 on a $20 buy in, are you going to only comp the first one or would you prefer that gambler stay? Hmm... 

The amount put into the machine does not matter, the amount wagered per hand and the amount of hands played does. Which is why when I'm wagering $20-$30 PER MINUTE, drinks are comped, whether or not I am being successful. 

Unfortunately, the only bartender in Vegas that doesn't understand this works at this bar. 

So while they're letting in kids on the side trying to get laid, they're not comping your drinks unless you're dumping money to them. 

I'd go with... any other neighborhood bar in Vegas.

Been here several times, second time ordering food. The first chicken fingers were questionable. This place has terrible food, just orderd a BLT that was upsold, have had better Mc bacon cheese biscuts better than what i just received. Furtunately they forgot my soup. Drink comps are poor. Guess you needs to be a regular here.
Awful service. The girl bar tenders don't want to work. Also, who runs out of menus on a slow night?

Terrible service. 2 consecutive times we call in a to go order (last 2 Sunday's swing shift) we were instantly placed on hold for 5+minutes to a point where you wanna hang up. So we're at smiths next door and while on hold we head that way so see how busy they are. We get in there. There's one girl messing with decorations and the other is bsing with the 5 customers that were at the bar.... it's like wth? You can't take my 2 second order rather than leaving us on hold for 5 minutes every time we call? So we end up ordering in person.  On top of it somebody ALWAYS forgets something.... we enjoy your food. But your girls/staff aren't on it.

This place is decent for a local neighborhood bar, better than PT's...I like that it is located in Southern Highlands in a nice area.  Chill, laid back vibe..you can chill at the bar and watch sports or you can sit in the non-smoking area and eat also.  They have 2 pool tables for those people that like to shoot pool.  In terms of food...their burgers are really good and their fried twinkie with ice cream desert is really addicting! This is a great place to either pre-game before going out or to finish up the night.  Whenever I'm in Southern Highlands chillin with friends, we'll always hit this place up.

Just moved into the area and found my new late night spot! Great beer selection, super friendly service, and BOMB food! Especially the pastas and flatbreads! The place is not too cheap but definitely won't put a hole in your pockets. Gonna be a regular here for sure! Be sure to come late nights and visit Bartender Sailor, he's one hell of an entertaining dude!

Locals who have put in 20+ visits in its short history are better qualified to speak on this, so this will be a review based on one sandwich. But I'll get this out of the way: nice interior, nice TVs, better than average (for a bar) French onion soup.

For a late dinner, I had the "Tri Tip Dip" which is described as roasted tri-tip stuffed into a french roll served au jus.  Let's consider the lies.  First, it comes with some processed cheese not mentioned on the menu (correct me if I'm wrong). Next, this meat is clearly not roasted, but processed, tasting almost exactly like steak-umms. The meat itself contained some sizeable chunks of un-chewable gristle.  Tri-tip, even untrimmed, contains no gristle, so it had to be some other inferior cut.  Au jus means "its own juices", but this was certainly some sort of reconstituted powder (or worse) with very little beef taste to speak of.  But it did improve the sandwich.  Lastly, the roll has more in common with a hot dog bun than a baguette.  You don't get to call a roll "French" just because of its shape.

There was a distinct smell of skunk coming from one of the cars in the parking lot on our way out.  Must have been the chef.

2
Never went back 
Bartender was more interested in the local drunkards than gaining new locals... Food was standard bar fare... No upselling or anything, asked questions with not so much as minimal interaction...very blaisé...Beers okay, nothing spectacular
But seriously that bartender rubbed me the wrong way, to the point I didn't go back for free drinks even... I'd rather pay and enjoy myself.

Enjoy your cheap tippers... Way to lose $$$
Genius caliber...

The TLAC is a great place to chill out if you are a local or in the area just killing time.  I was down in this neck of the woods several times this year and needed a good hour and half to find something to do.

Who says you can't have a beer or two for breakfast?  Certainly no one I know.  Kind of dark (lighting) with plenty to watch on the TV's, one can enjoy wasting time while sipping on a cool one.  

The bartenders are friendly and social.  When they were busy planning for a function,  a waitress was quick to jump out an take my order.

If I lived in a three mile radius of TLAC, I know I would be an almost permanent fixture there.

Worst. Bartender. Ever. 

One night I left because I couldn't catch his eye, among about all three patrons. Came back tonight because well, a girl works up a thirst and there isn't much in this neck of the desert. Same tall drip, same problem. Maybe I should put my tits on the bar. 


 However, there is a pool table, the food is decent, Jane's Addiction was on the muzak when I arrived and the waitresses on the floor seem personable.

I am disappointed in this place. I was a huge fan of coming here for drinks and food. I absolutely love their shrimp fajitas. All my friends that have come with me before no longer come because every time we receive awful service. I kept giving it a chance but today was my last visit. 

My husband and I went in for some food and drinks. We received our menu and immediately knew what we wanted to order. So we sat and waited. 15 minutes later somebody finally asked if we were ok and I told her we wanted to order. The food came out, it was good and then we were ready for our check. The bartender asked if we needed anything and I said "yes a to-go box and our checks." She then went on to doing other things, including taking shots with other guests and chatting it up with the people next to us. We waited a good 20 minutes and then we decided to just leave. I left $20 cash on the table. That should have covered most of the bill but I don't really care, they should have been more attentive to us. I have never walked out on a place before until now.I work in a restaurant as well and I would never be so in attentive to a guest. Management needs to do something about their staff.

This place was surprisingly amazing! First time going there I went for some dinner with my dad. Ordered a bbq burger cooked medium and ended up with one if the best burgers I've had in my life. Along with the delicious stuffed potato appetizer this place gots some great food. Check it out if you're ever on this side of town definitely worth every penny and the customer service was great!

I actually prefer this Lodge to the others in the area. For whatever reason, it just seems lighter and prettier. It is less of a party-like scene and more friendly. And the bartenders are nicer. Plus, karaoke nights are kinda fun and awesome.

Have met friends here before and it was pretty cool... this time however I brought some gamers in... 5 of them to play... there were people at the bar and none playing.. just chilling and watching games. Asked the bartender if there were any available games and she looked around and said no. Sat on the couches and watched no one play. Tried to bring some gaming business but the bartenders were somewhat cliquish in who the paid attention to. Sad because the bar is nice and has a nice set up... also while sitting in couches the hostess never came over and bartenders never acknowledged us... too bad because I host gamblers all the time but will never bring anyone here... some just want to get off the strip and chill, gamble and watch games. Poor service and bartenders are more interested in people at bar NOT gambling...

Lodge is a wonderful neighborhood bar in Southern highlands.  Great bar food and drinks and awesome place to watch football and basketball.  Staff is cool and attentive.  Good happy hour bar food menu.

This bar is awesome. It has pool tables, a fire place, lounge area and it has so much space. The bartenders are so attentive and are ready to fill up your drink whenever you need it. I like coming here.

We came here because the 1st time was great. Our second time was awful. Awful service. Awful food. Took about 20 minutes just to get drinks. Server didn't know her job. Some of our food came out before others at our table. Order fries they came out like 10 mins after our meal.  Dissapointed for sure this time. Will be awhile before we come back
This is my spot, never too busy and good paying machines . The main bar tenders are great and the servers are very good too.

I'm always impressed with the staff. Very friendly, quick to help and will chat with you as much as they can.  Good food, not amazing but well above average bar food.  

The place is always very clean and the bar separation is good between the restaurant and bar regarding keeping the smoke out.  I usually go in for lunch so not over crowded.

Just checked this off of the list of places to eat in southern highlands area. The quality of food was horrible, and thats going in with low expectations of bar food. Couldnt finish my wings. I got the worse aftertaste from the food. Maybe old fryer oil, maybe old chicken... either way i will not be giving this place another try.
Unfortunately like everyone else has said, the service is absolutely awful. Rude and sloooooow. The food is decent but not worth it. I definitely wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!

My family and I go here weekly!! Usually on Wednesday nights because all food & drinks are half off!! The food is so great and I love their servers! Katie is our favorite but they are all fantastic!! All their food taste homemade which is the best part!

This is the 4th time we have been at this Lodge.  I'm not sure why we come back because there service is always bad.  They have changed the menu and what we had was very good but there waitress service is always very slow.  They never have enough staff.  Not sure if we will come back and it is unfortunate because we live in the area.

There is definitely reason why this place has so many one star reviews. Word of mouth is the best way to kill your business. I called at 5 a.m this morning. some man picked up and rudely said yes? I said can I place an order for pickup? He said what do you want? I said pancakes. he said what??! And then hung up. I tried calling back three times. Lazy ass Motherfucker doesn't want to pick up the phone. Memo to Lodge Cactus : your employees represent your business. Clearly you don't give a s*** about the people that actually make your business run - the public, when you have asshats working at your establishment.

If you're in the Southern Highlands area looking for a place to relax, unwind, and grab a drink, this is the place for you!  They have a great, friendly staff, a wide selection of alcohol at the bar, and tasty bar food!  My favorites to order are the Country Fried Chicken and their Garlic Parmesan Chicken Fingers.  I often go here late at night with some friends to hang out, grab some drinks, and play pool.

Food was excellent and the waitress was cute. Will definitely be back for both.

Not sure how long yelp wants the reviews to be so this is just filler.

Open 24 hours. Of course, it's Vegas, after all. 
You walk in and it's like a game show: 
Door #1 or Door #2. 
On your right, the entrance to the bar.
On your left, the entrance to the dining area. 

We were in the mood for something comfort-foody and fun near the house, so my Hostest with the Mostest in LV took me here. 
Prices with a beer are around $15-20 per person- dining area is small but NOT smoky b/c there's a glass partition between the dining area and the bar (hurray.) 

Service was good, friendly- they have multiple flat screens that show sporting events and the like, so i would imagine, a fun place for a meal and then drinks during The Big Game/Match/whatever. 

Menu items are burgers, salads, sandwiches, fish and chips.... Your main good ol' American Standards, and the ambiance is low-light 'lodgey' which is kind of a nice change. Not as Lodge-y as The Great Northern, but still, fun.

The four of us walked in thirsty and quite hungry, ready to spend some money. Unfortunately after 10
Minutes we weren't acknowledged at all. The waitress (blue hair)even helped a lady who walked in after us and pretended we were invisible. Dear management. This is bullshit. We left. Check yourself before you wreck yourself. 

Quick tip: don't go here ever. Trust me. 
 
Boo boo boo.

I came in to celebrate a friend's birthday, so I did not get to try any of their food or drinks. This is just a review of the experience. They have really high ceilings and a great environment. Although smoking is allowed at the bar, I did not smell it. They have a pool table, shooting game, and a golf game towards the back. The games were pretty entertaining. Also, the service was great. We were often asked what we needed and in a timely fashion. I also love the seating around the bar.

There is a closed-off area of the lodge that is for non-smoking. It actually even has a different entrance than the bar. I think this is great, since people don't want to smell smoke when they are eating.

I hope to come back to try their food.
We come to this bar often because it's close to home but the new server, Bria, is awesome.  She's one of the most friendly and attentive servers we've had here. A+.

Great locals spot.

The bartenders are super friendly and attentive. The food is pretty good too. They have a very fun and cozy atmosphere and  they even have a non smoking dining area.

This was by far an amazing experience, pat the bartender is awesome! He makes you feel like this bar is home, you are comfortable, he is social, makes you feel welcome, just an all out great guy -- keep him for a looooong time please because we will all keep coming back! Thanks again pat! Because of you we love this bar!

-Daylee,Luis, Dustin and Andrea

This was my first time here and let me tell you the food was very good and Ariel was excellent very good customer service and very friendly.. The pricing is excellent. I like to go to a place we're your not rushed to order you food right away. I felt very comfortable here and I would definitely come back and recommend to family My and friends...       THANKS ARIEL FOR THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE...
People like to bitch- I've been here multiple times. Good food and good service. Just remember you're at a local bar... Not a steakhouse. If you want that kind of service go somewhere else.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!

Male Bartender that worked during graveyard on 4/22 has the worst customer service. Empty glasses, no interaction or whatsoever. I rather talk to my dog and I'm sure I will get a bark out of it. It seems like he owns the place because he 86 anyone for no reason. Didn't even know I had a tab!!!
If you like to be mistreated and ignored this is the place for you and you will even get kicked out trough the back door. Watch out locals!!

When I am too lazy to cook, this is my go to place. I have also been here for happy hour with a coworker many times. 
I like the option of sitting in the bar which is loud and smoky or in the dining room which is much more quiet and non smoking. The wait staff seems to be overwhelmed most of my visits, but they handle it with ease and the orders are taken and brought to the table within a reasonable amount of time. There are plenty of TVs to keep you entertained. The menu has a variety of comfort foods such as soups, salads, hamburgers, sandwiches, sides, alcohol, and desserts. 
I see plenty of single folks, couples, and big groups of people enjoying a meal at the Lodge- I say give this location a try if you are in the area.

We started coming here 4 years ago and have never had a bad meal or bad service . We loved this place. The chef was fantastic !!! Until a couple weeks ago when we went to dinner and what was meant to be a $40 dinner turned into a $4000 dinner the next day on my Amex card. Thank god Amex is on top of things and took care of it . Big mistake by the waitress!! Then to top it off tonight we went to dinner and noticed the menu changed. Fine , but when we got our food everything was wrong and my husbands dinner was gross. (Chicken fried steak) Ingredients we asked not to be included on our meal were on me and my sons meal . My husband got my daughters side and my daughter got my husbands side. I'm just very confused because after all these years of a great place to eat , it goes down hill in a week? I do have to say that they gave us my meal for free for all the trouble. The waitress made it right but something is going on in the kitchen . The chef we knew would never let any of this happen . New management ??

A great place to enjoy some cocktails and food or to shoot a game of pool. The prices are reasonable and the quality is definitely much better than any other bar food.  The servers and bartenders were always super friendly and on top of their game. It is much cleaner and the food is better then Pt's and the atmosphere much cozier. 
Through the high, wooden ceiling the space feels open....you won't have that depressing, dark "gaming bar feeling".

I left a negative rating about The Lodge 6 days ago.  It was an emotionally charged Yelp and I am taking the time to explain a statement that I made.
I made a comment about drug pushers.  I was extremely buzzed and was referring to alcohol.  Alcohol is a mind and mood altering substance and I have learned that alcohol is a drug.

The Lodge has the best food around.  Despite my disagreement with one staff member I have had great service at The Lodge.
I have spent many great times there and I really hope that it is one of the most popular attractions in the Southern Highlands area.
I Love the burgers!
Ahi appetizer is great!
Ahi Tartar is incredible!
If you like a little spice you have got to try the Shrimp Diablo.  That dish is outstanding!!!!
Infinity props to Nick
Apologies to all involved in a back and forth disagreement six nights ago.
Being human is what makes every single one of us so special.
The Lodge is a very fun and rewarding place where the food is great, staff is greater.
I recommend The Lodge on Cactus to all.

Great food, chill hang out - only down fall is daytime bartender Thursday - Saturday unfreindly, poor service and she never smiles. She gets wrapped up in girly conversations and forgets about the rest of the bar. Management, you need to take a hard look at this one.

No business , no service , food just ok , what someone else could do with this location !! Staff doesn't acknowledge you and could care less if you get up and leave ! Won't be back ! To bad not many places to eat in southern highlands !
Superb wait staff and very fun atmosphere.  This could be a great Sunday hangout with FB season about to start!
Food came out hot, some guy won a huge jackpot and I had a blast with the staff and loved the rounds of pool.

First time here.  Had the Denver Omelette - it was pretty good, but would have liked it better if it came with cheese.  Bri was our waitress and she is a real sweetheart!!  Great personality and goes above and beyond to make sure our experience was a good one!!  We'll be back!!

Horrible.   I couldn't even finish the food after a few bites.   I would never go back here.   Place itself
Seems like a dump and the food obviously was not worth the money.

Wanted to grab a bite and some drinks while watching the eagles/redskins game. The lodge was close so we went here. First impression was good. We were greeted by our bartender Chris and asked what we were having and if we were hungry. Chris introduced himself and his partner behind the bar Mitch. Drinks came, food came, good night right? This changed as we waited 25 minutes for a another drink. I had two drinks over the course of three quarters of football and had to ask for the second. The bar wasn't packed at all and yet it seemed tasking to get a drink. This was until we had no plates, no drinks and were waiting for our friend to finish his 3rd beer, which he had excellent service throughout the night. Not saying Mitch and Chris are bad bartenders, everyone has an off night. Just concerning as we were told this place was good to go. The highlight of the evening was our "chef" who kept checking on us and had a great personable interaction with us all night.

Looking forward to watching basketball and having dinner at the bar.  The menu said chicken Marsala with grilled chicken on a bed of linguine and a Marsala sauce.  Imagine my surprise when I was brought a plate with spaghetti and an oily coated sauce and chopped up chicken.  No Marsala sauce and no linguine.  The waitress came by and asked how I liked it and I told her I didn't and it wasn't as described in the menu.  She said oh.  I asked her if she new the difference between spaghetti and linguine and she said no and I said neither does the chef. Next time I saw her was when she gave me a bill for $16.  Won't be returning.

Amazing Reuben in the last place I would expect to find an amazing Reuben. And...I was able to actually get some work done without the usual loud Nevadans that I find everywhere else. (Just moved from the Bay Area...I'm still a little biased obviously)

I love the lodge and I used to come here quite frequently for drinks and late night gambling. I took a little break, and am now back for a drink and some snacks. It hasn't lost that good old Lodge spark. Lolllllll you know what I mean. 

I just appreciate the fact if I get too drunk I'm close enough to walk home #Oops so southern highlands-ians, come here and get drunk. And spend your money and tip the women.

Good food. 
Good service. 

Enjoyed the burgers. The philly cheese steak burger order was the only exception. On a to-go order, took the food to find almost zero onions and peppers and cheese which was of course the reason for the order. Also the order of fries on the same to-go order, was minimal compared to what you get in the restaurant.

Still though, for the area, it's the best.
The bartenders are all so amazing and treat me like family. The waitresses are great, and I love the food too. My new local spot.

Great bar 
Service is outstanding 
Food is great
Great happy hour
3-6 pm
I can recommend to all

Went in the other day and over heard the waitress talking about how she caused another waiter to quit from trying to sleep with him. He was a married man. Completely disgusted, I have a lot of friends in the industry and will def tell them to avoid that place. Never been so disgusted. Food was good though. #betterhideyohusbands

This place really is the worst. I stopped in recently since I haven't been in quite some time. I thought it would be different but nope. Same pompous, arrogant, no personality bartender that gives terrible service. That will be our last visit. We will just go to one of the other bars in the area instead.

Good food and never too busy. Salads are fresh, onion rings crisp, not greasy and the sourdough bread has flavor. We are quickly becoming regulars as the pricing is good. Service is friendly, but sometimes a little slow. Since the area has so few choices for inexpensive dining, frankly I am surprised that they are never crowded here.

This place is a joke. The bartenders must be to rich because they don't care about there guest. Went in to watch the football game and play a little bit. Put $40 in the machine and was playing .50 at a time. Played for about 1 hour and had 3 beers. Lost all of the $40 and when it was all said and done they gave me a bill for $18. They wouldn't even comp one beer because I was not playing the machine loaded even know I just spent $40. Glad there tip help pay for the beer. Will never go back there again.
Great service but the food was terrible. Just stick to drinking and pool here then head to Roberto's next door for food.

Fun environment, name speaks for itself.. Love the lodge house vibe. Cool place to play pool and have drinks with friends. Friendly girls working behind the bar were attentive and always made sure we were taken care of.

Well all I can say is the chicken wings we ordered were still half frozen when served to us. We told the server, he reaches onto our plate and grabs a wing off of it, then says "yea, you're right, let me tell the cook" He comes back out and takes another wing off the plate to "check if they're all cold" at this point I don't want any of the food on the plate after his hands have been in it. The nachos were very, um, creative? They had canned stewed tomatoes. Stewed tomatoes. Gross.  I asked for a greyhound with kettle one, which was basically ocean spray white grapefruit juice, no kettle one. 

So in closing, I'd say avoid this place. Go next door to Roberto's. You have a better chance of getting decent nachos.

The place is cool, except for the angry looking Asian man (must be management??) that stands at the end of the bar with his arms crossed..not sure what his purpose is, maybe he's a bouncer??    Don't see that in other local bars... Weird...

This is definitely a local spot. But come on look where it's at. As far as bars go it's sort of limited in Southern Highlands. But the lodge isn't bad, I've come here many of times for drinks and the bartenders are rather cool. I love playing pool here when I get the chance and the food is , well normal bar food. Nothing bad. The atmosphere is very laid back but I only thing (and it's what all lodges have) is I tend to get too relaxed and want to head home to sleep...

Place absolutely sucks!!!

AVOID!!!!

One can drive a mere one  mile down the road and go to terriffic bar. THE DISTILL

It has been a few years since we had gone to this place. The wife and I decided to play some Golden Tee. In the past, we would have been neglected and would play one round because there wasnt any service. Last night we had a waitress, Arielle (sp), who was amazing. The place has cleaned up quite a bit and their service is excellent. Needless to say, we will probably start going back more regularly. Thanks everyone.

my roomies and I love the lodge, we live about 5 minutes away so this is a great place to go to after work for a few drinks and late night eats, I go for either the mushroom burger, spinach dip (with 1/2 garlic bread 1/2 chips) or the BLT on sourdough, a little pricey at about $9 for a burger but after midnight the bartenders and waitstaff are super nice and it's convenient to where we live.  **I've won a couple times on bar slots too woohoo!

Pros: food is good and beer/ drinks are reasonably priced. They have 2 pool tables, nice bathrooms and the environment is pretty cool. 

Cons: service is TERRIBLE. I been here twice already but this second time I almost walked out. We sat in the Lounge area, came for dinner. The waitress brought our menus and said she would be right with us. She came back 2x after that and said "be right with you"... Um okay - still waiting. What really got me was we were waiting for 15- 20 mins (she never even got our drinks) and then a couple said right in front of us and the waitress brought their menus and less than 1 minute later went back to get THEIR drinks! Hello! We have been waiting and never even took our order yet! On top of that, once we finally put our order in and got our drinks, my wife had a used straw in her water glass. You can tell someone had already sucked through the straw and there was a small piece of food at the top! So disgusting! We ended up eating our meal (also went a bit wrong but don't want this review to be too long winded) and left. Do know if I'll be coming back.

I love this place ! Great place ,great food customer service is outstanding!!! They go out of there way to make you feel like family !! The entire bar staff Is amazing! The GM chris will literally goes out of his way to ensure you have a great experience!!  Oh and Krystal is the shit!!

Had a late morning Saturday breakfast here.  Basic steak & eggs, well-executed, quality bread used for toast (always nice), entirely adequate, no complaints, great value for money, chill & subdued atmosphere.  Went for weekend breakfast, it was infinitely preferable to Rise&Shine across the street (where I'd have been asked to wait 30 minutes to pay twice as much for zero service before being shoved out the door).  I'll be back.
This is my favorite place to unwind and grab a bite to eat after work.  "Togo orders" are always on point and not to mention the staff is amazing.   Chris makes the best spicy bloody Mary's ever.

The lighting and space within the property makes the stay comfortable.  Food is made well enough. Bartenders are tight when it comes to serving people other than their buddies.  Not a bad bar but there nothing special in it for me here.

I am only giving this place 1 star, not because I don't like the food and promptness, but because an error was made when the server charged another patrons meal to my card and vice versa. When I caught the mistake I went over to the Lodge at Cactus and was told by the bartender that the GM would be in that afternoon and would call me.  I never heard from anyone.  I disputed this with my bank and they didn't hear from The Lodge either.  My bank ended up shutting down my bank card for fraud in the middle of a move to another State.  You can imagine how this felt, on a Sunday!  I will never come back here or refer this place to anyone.  Accidents happen and I gave them the benefit of the doubt, they could have cared less about their mistake or me as a former loyal customer.  Shame on them.
No one present. When she was she was awesome.not really a bad review. Just jackass staff
This bar reminds me of an upscale PT's. It has gaming but also has pool tables and food. Drinks were kinda high

We live right across the street so we used to be regulars here. The last time we were here(which happened to be this morning), we waited a good ten minutes before we saw a server, although we could hear them chatting up their weekend plans in the kitchen.  It took another ten minutes to get our drinks. After waiting another fifteen+ minutes for someone to come back and take our order, we finally gave up, left some money on the table for our drinks and left. This will be the last time we visit this place. Unfortunately the food isn't good enough to have to deal with such awful service.

Went there to kill time while I was getting my car serviced at Tire Works. Though I have been here before, and this was my fourth time coming here, I felt compelled to give my two cents about this place. In particular the service and food I received on my last visit. 
Consistent great customer service. Both the bartender and waitress were extremely friendly & helpful. Decent bar food and prices. I had the wings n fries. Hot n spicy like I like them, and the fries were crispy!! The video poker machine was being good to me and my drink of Seagrams 7 Diet Coke was spot on, served in a decent size glass with the right amount of ice!! Overall I had a great experience on my last visit & made my time fly while waiting for my car's new tires next door. The only thing is don't order any mix drink. They use the heavy syrup bottle stuff ( Bloody Mary's, margaritas) other than that...if you stick to beer and straight up liquor drinks...you'll be fine!! This is the only reason why I did not give 5 stars.

They have done a great job with this place.  Went out there to visit a friend  and really had an awesome time.  Food looked amazing and the staff was super friendly and funny.  I cannot wait to go back again and bring more of my friends!  Worth the drive!

This place is right down the street from our house! We have been her twice before, and every time the service is VERY slow. We went in for breakfast this morning because the cafe across the street was busy and my husband had to be to work soon. Once again I don't know why we went back. The service is terrible!! And even the food sucked! Our server had no personality never said good morning or introduced herself. Rude. I ordered the French toast breakfast with potatoes well done and they came out soft and mushy!  I told her that I ordered them well done and she said I can have them re do them. I said no because we were already in a hurry but that when someone orders something well done it should be cooked. No apologies from her. The French toast was like cardboard and 5 minutes later she brings out a plate of well done potatoes and sets them on the table and walks away. I'm assuming to avoid taking my meal off the bill. The staff here is and always has been so fucking rude! I have never not tipped someone, but today I didnt tip her at all. This bar better start re thinking who they hire and who they're working here because I'll tell you right now I am never coming back and I will make sure my friends family and neighbors don't either!

As we walked into the dining room I noticed it was quite warm. I thought maybe it was because the door was open from outside but walking to the Lounge side I knew there was something wrong. We looked past that and decided to give it a try. The menu here is similar to pretty much any bar menu you'd find out there, the typical wings, nachos etc. 
I ordered a Margarita to start and it was most definitely the worst I've ever had. I pretty much can judge a place by the drinks served, but in this case I was partly wrong. This is the reason for 4 stars in this instance. 
I ordered the Chicken Parm. It was huge! Enough for 2 for sure. The outside was dry from being a little overcooked but it was tasty. My husband ordered Salmon which was barely enough for 1, which ended up being good because I needed help. He said it was one of the best he's ever had. 
Our server was super attentive, warm room and dry chicken aside it was a great experience. We will be back, more reviews to continue...

Nice local bar with decent pub food. 

I enjoy breakfasts here with my little girl on the weekends. And go Wednesday nights for buy one get one free entrees. 

I really like the sandwiches and the salads. My little one likes the sliders and chicken fingers. 

Only draw back, the service can be a bit slow, so if your in a hurry recommend asking for check or it might not come.

2nd time and still can't get it right. Ordered a bacon cheeseburger with cheddar cheese and fries and I get a plain cheeseburger for the second time I also ordered a side of onion rings I wouldn't really call five fucking onion rings aside. Avoid avoid avoid the lodge in Southern Highlands it is horrible food they never get it rightWe're not talking brain surgery here it's fucking bar food hire people to speak the language and maybe they'll get the fucking order right. I will not ever be back to the shit all known as the lodge at cactus

Great food and awesome bartenders. I'm here at least twice a week. This past time I ate here and the Chef Victor came and delivered the food and asked how it was. You expect those kind of things from a fine dinning restaurant. He could be that chef that just hands the food to the servers and that's that but he didnt. Thank you

The worst place in Las Vegas for service. It sucks !!!!!!!!!!!!!! They train their people to not make eye contact. Takes forever for food or drink. Lard ass bartender is a joke. Tall and stupid . 
I would not recommend this place to anyone.

It took me 2 years to realize that this place was a true gem. It's literally 1 minute away from my house, but I never cared to go in. After one long night, my boyfriend and I decided to check this place out. We were really impressed with how their food tasted, especially the NY Steak and Eggs! It is now our late night spot & I love how they're open 24 hours. 
I also recommend the Salmon with Lemon Pepper Shrimp and the Ahi appetizer for all you fish/seafood lovers.

This place has a decent menu with good food and reasonable prices. Most of the lunches and breakfasts are under $10. Drink prices are not bad either. My girlfriend and I often like to come here for breakfast. 

The crowd is usually fairly light. The bar area is very clean and has plenty of room for socializing with friends in a cozy environment. There are pool tables in the back. A separate dining room is present if you want to eat away from the occasional smokers in the bar.

I absolutely hate it when places like this remove items off their menu. People come for the food.  They lose customers like myself when they change their menus. It's not like the service was why we came as it is mediocre at best. It's local for us so our friends and family will be on the hunt for a new place.
I had a pleasant experience here. I stopped in around 1am for a night cap and the bartender, Sai, was very nice. I was served quickly and my drinks were good. I'll be back in the near future.
This place is awful how it has 3 stars I'll never know. Service is terrible and with so many more options now in the neighborhood, I like look forward to their closing.

My husband and I went there with 2 other couples.  Had a good time, but a few days later we all noticed that they charged an additional tip on our cards.  If it just happened to one of us I would count it as human error, but all 3 of us had anywhere from $10 to $17 of additional tip on our bills.  It was quite noticeable since we each only had 1 or 2 drinks.  I am pissed that I left her $5 on a $16 bill now!!!! She should have got nothing!!
The Food was good!  Service staff were weak!     Good beer and food.    It's always the people who bring the dinning down!   Good luck next time!

We eat here quite a bit and the only reason I am putting two stars is because of the afternoon staff. The food is good but the morning waitress is horrible!!! She has the personality of a garden gnome! She takes forever to get anything and she doesn't refill drinks EVER!! There isn't words to describe how bad of a waitress she is. We've thought at times it might be because she had something going on but... NOPE!!! She should be working in a mindless job sucking dick or something like that!
Monica and Jen are the best bartenders in the southern Highlands if not all of Vegas! They really make you feel welcome. :)
Used to really like this place. But just came here and sat for 40 minutes and no one ever came up to us. Got up and left. Huge disappoint.

Late night munchies it was either this place or Del Taco. 
Glad I came here! Asked the bartender what was good here he said everything so I thought oh great guess I will pick something and hope for the best 

Well bartender was right! This pasta dish is insanely good 
Pasta primavera 
Delicious!!!

Came back here for a midweek breakfast on a whim after we vowed to never come back because the service was so horrible. 

Glad we came back for another try because their new waitress Chandra is great! Attentive and was even super friendly with my 10 year old. She made suggestions for her due to some dental issues she was having. Now that the mornings seem to be covered, I'll have to try dinner and drinks with the hubby at night.

Thanks for the great morning and wonderful breakfast!
